alert.note: Alert for Imperial (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 19 at 8:51AM PDT by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 1045 AM PDT THIS MORNING... ...REPLACES FLASH FLOOD WARNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast California, including the following county, Imperial. * WHEN...Until 1045 AM PDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Low-water crossings are inundated with water and may not be passable. Highway 98, west of El Centro, is currently closed due to flooding and debris. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 850 AM PDT, emergency management reported heavy rain along Highway 98 west of El Centro due to thunderstorms. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Between 1.5 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Palm Canyon Wash, Gert Wash, Myer Creek and Carrizo Wash. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Ocotillo and Coyote Wells. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe.
